name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 1,4-dione ring with a pyridine base and a methylamino group. The pyridine base itself has a melting point around 106°C due to the presence of a piperidine ring. The methylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The naphthalene ring introduces additional pi-pi interactions and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C.
